t: Numbers 28
Daily Offerings
Now*p the Lord*s spoke to Moses, saying,
“Command the children of Israel, and say to them, ‘My offering, My food for My offerings made by fire as a sweet aroma to Me, you shall be careful to offer to Me at their appointed time.’
“And*p you shall say to them, ‘This is*i the offering made by fire which you shall offer to the Lord:*s two male lambs in their first year without blemish, day by day, as a regular burnt offering.
The one lamb you shall offer in the morning, the other lamb you shall offer in the evening,
and one-tenth of an ephah of fine flour as a grain offering mixed with one-fourth of a hin of pressed oil.
It*i is*i a regular burnt offering which was ordained at Mount Sinai for a sweet aroma, an offering made by fire to the Lord.*s
And its drink offering shall*i be*i one-fourth of a hin for each lamb; in a holy place*i you shall pour out the drink to the Lord*s as an offering.
The other lamb you shall offer in the evening; as the morning grain offering and its drink offering, you shall offer it*i as an offering made by fire, a sweet aroma to the Lord.*s
Sabbath Offerings
‘And*p on the Sabbath day two lambs in their first year, without blemish, and two-tenths of*i an*i ephah*i of fine flour as a grain offering, mixed with oil, with its drink offering—
this*i is*i the burnt offering for every Sabbath, besides the regular burnt offering with its drink offering.
Monthly Offerings
‘At*p the beginnings of your months you shall present a burnt offering to the Lord:*s two young bulls, one ram, and seven lambs in their first year, without blemish;
three-tenths of*i an*i ephah*i of fine flour as a grain offering, mixed with oil, for each bull; two-tenths of*i an*i ephah*i of fine flour as a grain offering, mixed with oil, for the one ram;
and one-tenth of*i an*i ephah*i of fine flour, mixed with oil, as a grain offering for each lamb, as a burnt offering of sweet aroma, an offering made by fire to the Lord.*s

Their drink offering shall be half a hin of wine for a bull, one-third of a hin for a ram, and one-fourth of a hin for a lamb; this is*i the burnt offering for each month throughout the months of the year.
Also one kid of the goats as a sin offering to the Lord*s shall be offered, besides the regular burnt offering and its drink offering.
Offerings at Passover
‘On*p the fourteenth day of the first month is*i the Passover of the Lord.*s
And on the fifteenth day of this month is*i the feast; unleavened bread shall be eaten for seven days.
On the first day you*i shall*i have*i a holy convocation. You shall do no customary work.
And you shall present an offering made by fire as a burnt offering to the Lord:*s two young bulls, one ram, and seven lambs in their first year. Be sure they are without blemish.
Their grain offering shall be of fine flour mixed with oil: three-tenths of*i an*i ephah*i you shall offer for a bull, and two-tenths for a ram;
you shall offer one-tenth of*i an*i ephah*i for each of the seven lambs;
also one goat as*i a sin offering, to make atonement for you.
You shall offer these besides the burnt offering of the morning, which is*i for a regular burnt offering.

In this manner you shall offer the food of the offering made by fire daily for seven days, as a sweet aroma to the Lord;*s it shall be offered besides the regular burnt offering and its drink offering.
And on the seventh day you shall have a holy convocation. You shall do no customary work.
Offerings at the Feast of Weeks
‘Also*p on the day of the firstfruits, when you bring a new grain offering to the Lord*s at your Feast*i of*i Weeks, you shall have a holy convocation. You shall do no customary work.
You shall present a burnt offering as a sweet aroma to the Lord:*s two young bulls, one ram, and seven lambs in their first year,
with their grain offering of fine flour mixed with oil: three-tenths of*i an*i ephah*i for each bull, two-tenths for the one ram,
and one-tenth for each of the seven lambs;
also*i one kid of the goats, to make atonement for you.
Be sure they are without blemish. You shall present them*i with their drink offerings, besides the regular burnt offering with its grain offering.
